content: I’m in my late twenties going through a divorce and the only thing my husband and I agreed on was not having kids. To other people, it invalidated my marriage. It wasn’t “real” because we didn’t have “real” responsibilities. Suddenly this also meant that I have an easy divorce because I don’t have to divide human assets. Less paperwork, sure… but a legal battle to end a relationship is never easy. On the flip side, people are now ecstatic that I can now date and pursue a new relationship to find a father for children I never want to have. The right guy isn’t going to change my mind. If anything, the right guy will support my decision to not have children.
